findings.title: Centralization risk
findings.description: The addLiquidity() function calls addLiquidityETH() with the parameter of lp tokens recipient set to owner address, which may accumulate a significant amount of LP tokens and pose a threat to token economics if the owner acts maliciously or its account gets compromised.

findings.title: Missing Testcases
findings.description: No test cases were performed to achieve good test coverage across the entire codebase.

findings.title: Re-initialize fee variables
findings.description: _tempTaxFee, _tempVaultFee, _tempLiquidityFee are initialized in _transfer function on certain conditions and may result in unwanted fee deductions for transfers if owner sets transferFee to false.

findings.title: Minimum amount to receive is 0
findings.description: Minimum amount of output tokens that must be received is 0, which allows trade to execute even when the output amount is very low. This type of transaction can be sandwiched by a malicious user/attacker.
